Yanick has a limited weekly income of $10, and he spends it all on Good A and shirts. Assume the price of Good A is $2 per unit and the price of each shirt is $4.

(a) Given his weekly income, would Yanick be able to buy 2 units of Good A and 2 shirts? Explain using numbers.

(b) Calculate the total consumer surplus from Good A if Yanick consumes 3 units of Good A. Show your work.

(c) Identify the quantity of Good A and the quantity of shirts that will maximize Yanick’s total benefit given his weekly income. Explain using marginal analysis.

(d) Assume Good A is produced in a perfectly competitive market and that there is an increase in the number of consumers in the market for Good A.(i) Will the quantity of Good A that will maximize Yanick’s total benefit increase, decrease, or stay the same? Explain.(ii) Would Yanick’s total consumer surplus from Good A if he consumes 3 units of Good A increase, decrease, or stay the same compared to your answer in part (b) ? Explain.
